comments:
With the WTP 2.0 05171455 driver, I got the following exception while doing a top-down Axis2 scenario:

Exception occurred while code generation for the WSDL null
    java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
    at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
    at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:64)
    at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
    at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:615)
    at org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.creation.core.command.Axis2WSDL2JavaCommand.execute(Axis2WSDL2JavaCommand.java:168)

I tried it again with the same workspace and a different project and got the same result.

However, when I tried a different workspace, I can go through a top-down Axis2 scenario successfully.

I suspect I ran into the problem because I had done other Axis1 scenario and tested with the WSE.  I think what I did in the workspace that failed was a bottom-up Axis1 Web service followed by testing the UDDI page on the WSE.  However, I could not reproduce it again on a new workspace either.  Please take a look at the stack trace of the failed scenario and see if you can spot what might cause this.  I suspect it might have to do with which plugins are loaded first when the Axis2 scenario is run.

Kathy, I could not reproduce this problem in a new workspace and doing bottom-up Axis1 Web service followed by testing the UDDI page on the WSE, and then doing the Axis2 Top Down Scenario. 

From the stack trace, what I can think of is that the service definition pointing wsdl in the main page of the web service scenatios is not correctly inserted/passed or the pointing wsdl can not be loaded as a Axis2 wsdl definition. Is there any cause by or a .log trace which I can look at?

Thanks 

Lahiru

I'm also getting the following intermittent error when going through an Axis2 client scenario:

Exception occured while code generation the wsdl
    java.lang.NoSuchMethodException: org.apache.axis2.description.WSDL11ToAxisServiceBuilder.setCodegen(boolean)
    at java.lang.Class.throwNoSuchMethodException(Class.java:274)
    at java.lang.Class.getMethod(Class.java:799)
    at org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.consumption.core.utils.WSDL2JavaGenerator.getAxisService(WSDL2JavaGenerator.java:369)
    at org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.consumption.core.command.Axis2ClientCodegenCommand.execute(Axis2ClientCodegenCommand.java:89)

I'm still trying to find a consistently reproducible scenario when this would always occur.  I still suspect it has something to do with combination of Axis1 and Axis2 scenarios.  I'll append more info when I have them.

I'm finally able to consistently reproduce the problem on the WTP 2.0 RC2 200706050057 driver.  Here's the steps:

1. In a new workspace, install a Tomcat 5.5 server and Axis2 1.2 runtime.
2. Create 2 dynamic Web project "a2a" and "a2aClient" adding Axis2 facet.  
3. Create an Axis2 top-down Web service (service slider set to START).  Click Finish.
4. Create an Axis2 bottom-up Web service with client (service and client slider set to START).  Click Finish.

Here's the error:

Exception occurred while code generation for WSDL null
    java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
    at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
    at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:64)
    at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
    at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:615)
    at org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.consumption.core.utils.WSDL2JavaGenerator.getAxisService(WSDL2JavaGenerator.java:379)
    at org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.consumption.core.command.Axis2ClientCodegenCommand.execute(Axis2ClientCodegenCommand.java:89)
    at org.eclipse.wst.command.internal.env.core.fragment.CommandFragmentEngine.runCommand(CommandFragmentEngine.java:418) 

After dismissing the error, I was still able to successfully generate Axis2 service and client by clicking Next all the way.  Afterwards, I could also repeat the bottom-up Axis2 scenario clicking Finish no problem.  So it only seems to happen the first time after skeleton Axis2 scenario.

I've also tried bottom-up Axis2 scenario followed by top-down Axis2 scenario.  That was no problem as well.

Note that when the InvocationTargetException occurs, here's what's on the console:

Retrieving document at 'http://localhost:8080/a2a/services/Converter?wsdl'.
[Fatal Error] loose.dtd:31:3: The declaration for the entity "HTML.Version" must end with '>'.
Jun 6, 2007 10:22:35 AM org.apache.axis2.description.WSDL11ToAxisServiceBuilder populateService
SEVERE: javax.wsdl.WSDLException: WSDLException: faultCode=PARSER_ERROR: Parser SAX Error: org.xml.s
ax.SAXException: Fatal Error: URI=null Line=226: The prefix "jsp" for element "jsp:include" is not bound.

However, after dismissing the error, the wizard would finish after clicking Finish again.

I also get the following in the console when the Axis2 client can be generated correctly:

Retrieving document at 'http://localhost:8080/a4/services/Echo?wsdl'.
[Fatal Error] loose.dtd:31:3: The declaration for the entity "HTML.Version" must end with '>'.
Retrieving document at 'http://localhost:8080/a4/services/Echo?wsdl'.

Hi Kathy , 

could not reproduse as how you explain in this scenarios. I strongly believe in my opinion that the problem here is that I am loading the wsdl definition more than onece. So trying to fix that with the minimum effect on the other codes. If you please try with little bit more memory and see whether this error poersist, that will be also helpful 

Thanks 

Lahiru
The sequence of steps to produce this is something of a corner case, and can be avoided or recovered from quite easily. Please write a limitation. Deferred to 2.0.1.

I've run into this problem with the WTP 2.0 06/13 driver still.  Please try to reproduce the problem following the steps in comment #3.  

There are also times when bottom-up plus client would always have the Axis2 client page coming up blank but then I could not reproduce it consistently yet.

Created an attachment (id=73428)
Fix for the 187840

Exception occurred while code generation for the WSDL null
    java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException

In the above UI error message the null part is because of the Invocation target exception not being having the message attach to it. Rather it contains an AxisFault Wrapped in the target. I have fixed this and what happen in these scenatio that are reported as failing the server returns an AxisFault due to various reasons like connection rest, fault message income, etc , 

This fix covers the part of the AxisFault unwrapping and displaying the correct
 user message. 

This is an isolated fix and we can safely include this to WTP 2.0.1

Thanks 

Lahiru

Having the Axis2 fault return definitely helped in diagnosting the problem.  Now with the patch, when I run the scenario defined in comment #3, here's what I got:

Exception occurred while code generation for WSDL :org.apache.axis2.AxisFault: WSDLException: faultCode=PARSER_ERROR: Parser SAX Error: org.xml.sax.SAXException: Fatal Error: URI=null Line=226: The prefix "jsp" for element "jsp:include" is not bound.
    java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
    at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
    at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:64)
    at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
    at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:615)
    at org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.consumption.core.utils.WSDL2JavaGenerator.getAxisService(WSDL2JavaGenerator.java:379)
    at org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.consumption.core.command.Axis2ClientCodegenCommand.execute(Axis2ClientCodegenCommand.java:90)

We need to find out the cause of this exception since doing a bottom-up follow by top-down is a common scenario.

Created an attachment (id=76016)
Updated new fix for the 187840

Seperate the https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=193593 fix and include only the relevant fix with the latest HEAD.

Patch reviewed and released to HEAD as v200708142114 and to R2_0_maintenance as v200708142118.

I'm still leaving this in Assign state since we still need to find out the real cause of the InvocationTargetException.  This patch would help us isolate the problem a bit more.

Created an attachment (id=76129)
Testing fix for the QA

Hi Kathy , 

Can you have a quick verification of this patch apply and see the result of the issue that was reported here. 

thanks

Lahiru
I tried the latest patch with the scenario reported in comment 3.  I do not get that error anymore.  So you can commit this change and I'll release it to a build.
Patch committed to HEAD.  Patch released to R2_0_maintenance as v200708151812 and to HEAD as v200708151814.

(In reply to comment #15)
> I tried the latest patch with the scenario reported in comment 3.  I do not get
> that error anymore.  So you can commit this change and I'll release it to a
> build.

Actually the reason behind this is the servlet container needed a split second of time to get the service deployed after the service and client invoked together. So     its always better that we forcefully deploy the service by invoking a fully build   of the Dynamic Web Project.

Thanks 
Lahiru
